website_summaries.verdict: Retrofit any 8-inch or larger frying pan into an egg poaching pan with this insert option.
pros: Includes a slot for your table knife to help pull from the pan when eggs are done
Good for small or medium eggs
cons: Even though these are made with a non-stick coating, a little grease or butter might still be necessary to help your eggs come free

customer_reviews.title: 3 egg poacher
customer_reviews.text: It works really well and does what it's supposed to do. However, don't use olive oil to grease the egg holders. That doesn't work. Use something that's thicker, like butter. Also, don't try the jumbo size eggs. They're just a little too big and spill over. The slightly smaller eggs are perfect and they come out beautiful and delicious.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy

customer_reviews.title: Basic and functional
customer_reviews.text: Basic, cheap, makes a good sized egg for muffin sandwiches, but don't use it in a pan that you don't want the bottom scratched up. I had an old dollar store pan with lid laying around, so it was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Axe

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly ...
customer_reviews.text: Used it this morning to make my husband's poached eggs, worked perfectly..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good egg poacher
customer_reviews.text: We have used it a few times. Even with the non-stick coating on it, you still need butter or oil. My only concern is how long it will last before the non-stuck coating chips....we will see. We get the perfect poached egg (with a dipable yolk) in 4 mins flat.
customer_reviews.author: Tibor Reimann

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: Love this egg poacher it is so easy to use easy to clean, well worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Joan

customer_reviews.title: Egg poacher insert is a good price, and does the job!
customer_reviews.text: I use it in a small fry pan, with a lid, to poach eggs.
customer_reviews.author: Linda aka Ace

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, cooks eggs to perfection!
customer_reviews.text: Just perfect, fits in any pan. Easy to store. Cleans up well. Makes 3 eggs at a time, which work for me. Fast cooking. Bring it out every Sunday for brunch. I bought this because I didn't have room to fit another pan in the cupboard.
customer_reviews.author: charlene spiller

customer_reviews.title: Fast easy to use, less to clean
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use in small omelette pan with lid
customer_reviews.author: shanna lawson

customer_reviews.title: Love this poacher
customer_reviews.text: truly easy to use and handle for quick poaching and easy clean-up. I prefer the less rubbery texture of the eggs as compared to microwave and actually less work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: The teflon coating is not impressive. The material is exposed to boiling water, steam and eggs; it should NEVER wear out - and yet, it does! This is a direct replacement for an older worn out unit.
customer_reviews.author: Baldy

customer_reviews.title: Great size
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use, just the right size, release of eggs is simple, especially if you use a rubber spatula around the edge first.
customer_reviews.author: Graham Byars

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Eggs easily release from cup. Eggs come out great. Some improvement opportunities- larger cups would be helpful. Can handle large egg. Larger sizes overflow.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Clean up
customer_reviews.text: What I really liked was eggs didn’t stick and clean up great.👍
customer_reviews.author: Ethel Ann Burson

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I place a small amount of butter in each section and place in a frying pan of water. Cheap and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Uki

customer_reviews.title: Easy Poached Eggs
customer_reviews.text: No hassle poached eggs. Could be a little easier to clean, but no big.
customer_reviews.author: T Tommy

customer_reviews.title: Egg Poacher
customer_reviews.text: This is the BEST! This is a great pan for making the perfect poached egg..easy, convenient and no mess pans!
customer_reviews.author: maribeth lisnock

customer_reviews.title: Wish I found this earlier...
customer_reviews.text: I look for ever, and tried every other gizmo on the market before finding this! Perfect poached eggs, every time!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Free would be to much for this so called nonstick poacher!!!
customer_reviews.text: Eggs stick no matter how much oil you use. Not worth your money or frustration.
customer_reviews.author: James S.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: works well...wish for a one egg poacher but this will do. Good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Constance W.

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I love this I product. This is replacing one I had for decades. So far it seems just as good as the old one.
customer_reviews.author: J. Morris

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an old one that was the same kind. Excited to find the same style. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia  Grosse

customer_reviews.title: Simply turn any pan into an egg poacher.
customer_reviews.text: This is Great! Any pan (6 inches in diameter) with a lid can become your egg poacher pan.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Three in minutes
customer_reviews.text: just add butter and three eggs. It fits in a small frying pan with 1/4" water. Slight boil and cover for 5 minutes-!!!
customer_reviews.author: DirtyHarry

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Cups are too small for a single egg, then they stick unless every spot is greased
customer_reviews.author: Whimsical

customer_reviews.title: Easy egg poacher
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for the same item. Have used this product for years; never a problem.
customer_reviews.author: John Birkholz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to have poached eggs in the morning. Clean up is easy.
customer_reviews.author: TVCowgirl

customer_reviews.title: like it
customer_reviews.text: gives good results using sauce pan and boiling water, recomend pan spray before putting eggs into it, a little difficult to handle with the eggs in it after poaching
customer_reviews.author: john smith

customer_reviews.title: easy peesy
customer_reviews.text: Love this! Eggs cook beautifully and are easy to remove from pan.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Malloy

customer_reviews.title: Easy!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, clean, and store. Plan to take it camping. Eggs turn out great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My buying experience was great! However
customer_reviews.text: My buying experience was great! However, this doesn't really fit any of my pans, and the molds don't hold a whole large egg. It's otherwise a good quality product.
customer_reviews.author: sjj

customer_reviews.title: Does not work as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I just got this thing, made 3 eggs. Went to clean it and IT IS NOT TEFLON COATED, you cannot get the egg off the surface I just tossed into the trash as I was not going waste my time returning it. Trust me I spent 5 min abrasive sponge and could not get it cleaned. Look elsewhere
customer_reviews.author: R. Simon

customer_reviews.title: non-stick ?
customer_reviews.text: It is not a non-stick cooking tool unless you use something such as Pam non-stick spray !
customer_reviews.author: Jim McC

customer_reviews.title: For Supper Small Eggs or Just Egg White
customer_reviews.text: Simply will NOT hold a Large, X-Large, or Jumbo egg in a single spot. It will work fine for healthy people that would want only egg whites. I wouldn't of ordered it if they would of described the size of the egg space accurately. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: MY

customer_reviews.title: Nice and Easy!
customer_reviews.text: I used an 8 inch pan to do my eggs. I sprayed the cups with oil before cooking and had no problem with the eggs sticking and they slid right out of the cups when serving. (I used a pan because I think that maybe other reviewers used a pan or pot that wasn't as deep as my saucepan and this caused them to stick)
customer_reviews.author: MB!

customer_reviews.title: Poached to perfection
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this egg poacher. Easy to use, fits perfect in my skillet and cooks my eggs to perfection. It can hold large or small eggs (extra large would be too big). I use a little butter in each well to prevent sticking and a spoon to loosen the edges, they come out perfect each time.
customer_reviews.author: CMcDonough

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: An easier way to poach eggs. You put it in a shallow pan, add water, and simmer it w/ the lid on. You need your own pan and lid. Inexpensive, and works better than the high-end, brand name product that I once used. Very flimsy. Store it with great care.
customer_reviews.author: Family guy

customer_reviews.title: Completely dissatisfied. Eggs are either undercooked or totally hard.
customer_reviews.text: Used in sealed pan, after three minutes half of the egg was cooked and the other raw. Seemed to cook only from the bottom up which left the top soft and raw. Complete disappointment. It will make a good lopsided frisby.
customer_reviews.author: denny_sf

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Simmer (low boil), cover, and 3 Minutes is all it takes for the perfect poached eggs. I coat mine with butter first, for easy non-stick removal of poached eggs. Eggs slide right out with small spatulate.
customer_reviews.author: A VN Vet

customer_reviews.title: Egg size
customer_reviews.text: Loved this poacher, but it works best with LARGE eggs. EXTRA large eggs are sometimes too big. Also not the easiest to remove from pan of boiling water.
customer_reviews.author: DeeDee

customer_reviews.title: Love poached eggs so will keep trying
customer_reviews.text: No matter what we oil the pan with, the eggs tend to stick in the pan. Love poached eggs so will keep trying.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbie

customer_reviews.title: Better than silicone
customer_reviews.text: I was so happy with this product I feel the metal ones work so much better than any silicone egg poachers! Super easy to clean as it is non-stick and really easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron M Wilkerson

customer_reviews.title: Cheapo junk
customer_reviews.text: Lasted about 6 months before the nonstick coating peeled off and the metal rusted. This is while strictly using only silicon spatula.
customer_reviews.author: Jack O.

customer_reviews.title: Nonstick is nonexistent months later. At first was the perfect poacher, thanks to size and shape. But will not last.
customer_reviews.text: Nonstick coating disappears after a few months, so unless you like a lot of butter, this is useless. At first: Perfect poacher. The size and slope of the egg cups is perfect. But now it's impossible to get the egg residue off, and everything sticks. This never went in the dishwasher and still failed.
customer_reviews.author: J. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Perfect replacement
customer_reviews.text: Fits our old reverware small pan for making perfect poached eggs. We had one of these for years but it broke. Perfect replacement
customer_reviews.author: M. Perry

customer_reviews.title: Works great Saves a lot of mess I have poached eggs ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great Saves a lot of mess I have poached eggs more ofen now
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: A little too shallow!
customer_reviews.text: Ok, but a little too shallow for the eggs. It must have been made for small size eggs.
customer_reviews.author: Julianne Hall

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't hold jumbo egg
customer_reviews.text: Put in jumbo egg in poacher and it fell over the side.
customer_reviews.author: Desertlover

customer_reviews.title: Serves its purpose but it is not non stick. ...
customer_reviews.text: Serves its purpose but it is not non stick. You have to use Pam or some type of oil or else you'll be scraping out your eggs.
customer_reviews.author: EAE

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This egg poacher works great. The eggs come out perfectly each time.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra G.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you grease the pan really good otherwise your eggs will stick.
customer_reviews.author: Talea S.

customer_reviews.title: Egg cups too deep, Sits too low in the water.
customer_reviews.text: Egg cups too deep, Sits too low in the water. The legs which support the tray only extend about a quarter-inch below the bottom of the egg cups...this means that you either have to use a very small amount of water, or that the eggs tend to get un-evenly cooked, due to the cups being half-submerged in hot water. Also, the egg cups are approximately 1" deep, which contributes to the un-even cooking problem...ideally, the egg cup would be about 1/2"-3/4", with a slightly wider diameter. The eggs tend to cook unevenly and stick, unless lubricated with a lot of butter and/or oil...difficult to clean, too.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley LeGitte

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: the individual cups are pretty small to fit large eggs. Wish they were a little larger.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work as well as I hoped, unless I am doing something wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Dmitriy Tabakov

product_meta.title: HIC Non-Stick 3-Egg Poacher Insert, PFOA and BPA Free
product_meta.description: Style Name:3-Egg PoacherHIC’s Non-Stick Egg Poacher for making a perfect poached egg, 3 at a time. Specially designed with a premium non-stick coating (PFOA and BPA free) to release foods easily while using less oil for low-fat cooking and healthier meals. A must-have of cool gadgets for making classic poached egg dishes and the perfect addition to cooking tools for the all day breakfast enthusiast. Make eggs benedict, breakfast sandwiches, and salad lyonnaise, or elevate dishes with a poached egg on top, like cobb salad, polenta, salmon, even chicken noodle soup, for a rich and comforting finish. Learning how to poach an egg has never been easier, and this easy egg cooker eliminates the need for a specialty egg poaching pan! Simple to use. Just fill a sauce pan, 8-inch or larger, with ⅜-inch of water. Bring to a boil then turn down to simmer. Lightly coat egg cups with oil, crack an egg into each cup, and carefully lower the Poacher into the simmering water. Cover the pan and allow the eggs to cook, about 2 to 4 minutes. The built-in slots make lifting the Poacher easy to keep hands safe. Just insert a knife tip or fork and lift. Made from non-stick carbon steel, HIC’s Non-Stick Egg Poacher is nonstick, PFOA and BPA free, heat safe (to 430-degrees Fahrenheit) and easy to clean. Hand wash in warm, soapy water with a soft cloth or sponge.
feature_bullets: HIC Non-Stick 3-Egg Poacher for perfect poached eggs, eggs benedict, breakfast sandwiches, and salad lyonnaise using less oil without foods sticking
Made from carbon steel with premium non-stick coating; PFOA and BPA free; heat safe to 430-degrees Fahrenheit
Lightly coat egg cups with oil, crack an egg into each cup, carefully lower into ¾-inch simmering water and cover until cooked, about 2 to 4 minutes
Fits 8-inch diameter pans or larger; insert knife tip or fork into the built-in slots to easily and to carefully remove from pan and keep hands safe
Easy to use; foods won’t stick for easy cleanup; no need for a specialty egg poaching pan; hand wash in warm, soapy water with a soft cloth or sponge
